original_title: Union Assurance sells 22 percent stake in Fairfirst Insurance to Fairfax Asia amid robust market conditions
original_body_lines: Union Assurance sold its 22 percent stake in Fairfirst Insurance Ltd to Fairfax Asia Ltd for Rs 2.63 billion, CSE sources said.

“UAL has divested its 22 percent equity stake comprising 30,800,000 ordinary shares, in Fairfirst Insurance Ltd., an associate company of UAL today, CSE sources explained. The total price was Rs 2,638,079,877.00. Fairfirst Insurance Ltd operates in the non-life insurance segment and was previously treated as an associate of the John Keells Group.

Amid those developments overall market conditions were positive and the All Share Price Index reached 21000 points. The All Share Price Index up by 119.83 points, while the S and P SL20 rose by 22.2 points. Turnover stood at Rs 6.5 billion with eight crossings.

Those 3 crossings were reported in JKH, which crossed three million shares to the tune of Rs 68.4 million and its shares traded at Rs 22.80, Aitken Spence 352,000 shares crossed for Rs 56 million and its shares sold at Rs 160, Asia Asset Finance 635,000 shares crossed for Rs 32.5 million; its shares traded at Rs 52.

Hemas Holdings one million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 31.5 million and its shares traded at Rs 31.50, Pan Asian Bank 400,000 shares crossed for Rs 24.6 million; its shares sold at Rs 61.50, Sampath Bank 150,000 shares crossed for Rs 21.1 million; its shares traded at Rs 140.75, RIL Properties 600,000 shares crossed for Rs 20.7 million; its shares traded at Rs 34.50 and Cargills Bank 2.2 million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 20.7 million; its shares fetched Rs 9.40.

In the retail market top seven companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; Sierra Cables Rs 1.2 billion (35.9 million shares traded), JKH Rs 248 million (10.9 million shares traded), LOLC Rs 236 million Rs 236 million (410,000 shares traded), LCB Finance Rs 181 million (28 million shares traded), Cargills Bank Rs 162 million (17 million shares traded), Asia Assets Rs 157 million (2.9 million shares traded) and First Capital Holdings Rs 152 million (2.6 million shares traded). During the day 377 million share volumes changed hands in 42046 transactions.

It is said that manufacturing sector counters, especially Sierra Cables and JKH, led the market while the banking and financial sector was also a major contributor to the turnover, especially Asia Asset Finance and LCB Finance.
Yesterday the rupee opened at Rs 302.10/18 to the US dollar, weaker from Rs 302.05/18 the previous day, while bond yields opened steady, dealers said.

A bond maturing on 15.12.2026 was quoted flat at 8.20/30 percent. A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted flat at 8.65/75 percent. A bond maturing on 15.03.2028 was quoted at 8.90/9.00 percent. A bond maturing on 15.06.2029 was quoted at 9.42/47 percent. A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted at 9.52/54 percent, down from 9.51/54 percent. A bond maturing on 15.05.2030 was quoted at 9.65/69 percent. A bond maturing on 01.07.2030 was quoted flat at 9.70/74 percent. A bond maturing on 15.03.2031 was quoted at 10.00/05 percent, from 9.98/10.05 percent. A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.39/44 percent.

The telegraphic transfer rates for the American dollar was 298.5000 buying, 305.5000 selling; the British pound was 403.1323 buying, and 414.4941 selling, and the euro was 349.2170 buying, 360.5802 selling.
